body.name: NIVEA MEN Sensitive Shaving Cream, 3.5 oz Tube
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 26 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 23 hrs 10 mins
features: Softens your beard for a close and extra comfortable shave.
Helps protect skin from shaving irritations.
World's No. 1 Men's Skin Care Brand. Source: Euromonitor International Limited; NIVEA in the category Men's Skin Care; in retail value terms, 2013.
body.description: The creamy formula was specially developed for men with sensitive skin. It’s very gentle and enriched with natural, soothing Chamomile and Witch Hazel extracts. It leaves skin looking healthy and cared for as well as feeling comfortable and smooth. Skin looks healthy and cared for. Skin feels comfortable and smooth.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #32,987 in Beauty & Personal Care (See Top 100 in Beauty & Personal Care) #69 in Men's Shaving Creams

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gives a great shave
reviews.reviewText: I get a very smooth and comfortable shave with out razor burn. Requires a small amount to be rubbed between my hands to produce a thick lather. And I like the way it smells.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nivea, please make again.
reviews.reviewText: Why am I reviewing something that is no longer manufactured and has sometimes been listed as 'unavailable' on Amazon? To record, for posterity, what an excellent product it is? To stage a hopeless protest against its discontinuance? To make symbolic plea to get it back in circulation? Maybe all of these.I love how well this works, either applied more as a cream directly by hand or whipped up into an excellent foam using a brush.It is a great travel option, given its size and the fact that it is not under pressure.It creates a perfectly balanced (not too light, not to heavy) buffer for the blade.It rinses off cleanly, leaving my skin feeling smooth.It does not dry or irritate my skin.I use the Nivea post-shave balm (also sensitive) afterwards, which is quite good in itself. They have a similar scent. When I first tried both, they were carried by my local supermarket. I recall feeling so fortunate to have found very high quality and dependable products available close by and at a fair price.I never tried the standard non sensitive version of either the cream or the balm, so I cannot compare.I have also tried the very good, canned Nivea shave gel - it was a gift from my wife. It works nicely, smells good, is convenient to use at home. That being said, I am a traditionalist who ditched the can and multi-blades years ago, and picked up a brush, safety razor and non-aerosol cream. Nivea was a great daily go-to. I like Proraso, too, which has similar features. I still think Nivea lathered a bit better.So I just bought this (Greek market?) four-pack. It will last some time. Who knows, maybe there is a stockpile in cool storage somewhere I can return to when I run out again.Meanwhile, if anyone from Nivea reads this - I know there are so few of us Americans who actually shave this way. I know there may be no profitable business reason to do so - please bring the tube back.On a related note, I've believe more and more Nivea is now sourced/made in Mexico. I suspect production of this product stayed in Germany and needed to be phased out. I was hoping - as there must be half a dozen or more Nivea varieties of the shower 'gels' - that this gem could somehow stay in the line up.(For what it's worth, the sensitive skin version of the shower gel is also very good.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Get this over the pressurized can
reviews.reviewText: It's one of two brands that all but eliminate my ingrown hairs and razor burn even when shaving against the grain. I also use a safety razor with good blades. I like this packagi g over the spray paint looking cans as I can better control the 'serving size', and since somlittle is needed, I can make it last much, much longer.Not cheap, tho.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Is this product still being manufactered.
reviews.reviewText: Have used it for more than 25 years. Sadly it appears to longer be stocked by both supermarkets for the past two months whilst they do stock all the other Nivea for Men products. I have gotten the impression that Nivea is no longer producing it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good, cheap but high quality product.
reviews.reviewText: It's a pretty cheap shave cream. But just cuz it's cheap doesn't mean it is low quality. The smell is pretty mild. It's a clean scent, it doesn't stick around for long after the shave so it wouldn't clash much with an aftershave or anything else. With a brush the lather I get is slick and thick. It's a good product, and it isn't that expensive, so I wouldn't feel bad about using a bit more than I need to. Or even using it every day. (I don't need to shave that often, but if I did, I could see using this and it wouldn't break the bank.)It put it right next to Proraso, it may not be some life changing product, but it's a good solid cream. I think it would work very well for someone just getting into wet shaving/ or using a brush and cream or soap.While I don't have that sensitive of skin, I will say after I shave with it, I don't feel like I need to use as much aftershave balm. My skin feels good after using it even before any aftershave balm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this shave cream for shaving with my Panasonic electric razor in the shower. I do not know why we don't see this product in US marketplaces. The 100mL size makes it easy for travel, and I just like the product. I do have sensitive skin, and this product makes shaving so much better for me. Amazon is the only place I can routinely locate this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great product….. overpriced here.
reviews.reviewText: This is just a normal tube of shave cream, not jumbo or xl. It isn’t worth the $7 per tube price tag in my opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised - and super rich lather
reviews.reviewText: This was taking a chance due to my sensitive skin - and i was pleasantly surprised. Not only does a little go a LONG way due to the rich lather - zero breakouts and zero cuts and scrapes. I break out with everything it seems,but this was perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am using this shaving cream 15 years ago.For me personally is the best option for shaving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 12, 2023
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 15, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I have always used nivea's sensitive shave gel and foam for shaving but wanted to try this with a shaving brush. Amazon is the only place I have seen this so it's quite rare which was reflected in its relatively high price at just over a fiver a tube. I have used it a couple of times with a brush and have created a good lather each time and have achieved a comfortable shave. The tube should last a good while, longer than a tin of gel or foam. The cream is of inferior quality compared to more luxury brands as you would expect so unless you can source this at its recommended price, I'd give it a miss.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I do love this cream. Using for 20-30 years now
